verses.text_plain: Send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land from Sela to the wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.
verses.verse_html:
1Send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land from Sela to the wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of Zion. ▼
▼ Sela: or, Petra: Heb. A rock

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Sela: or, Petra: Heb. A rock
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Sela: or, Petra: Heb. A rock

verses.text_plain: For it shall be, that, as a wandering bird cast out of the nest, so the daughters of Moab shall be at the fords of Arnon.
verses.verse_html:
2For it shall be, that, as a wandering bird cast out of the nest, so the daughters of Moab shall be at the fords of Arnon. ▼
▼ cast…: or, a nest forsaken

footnotes.body_html: ▼ cast…: or, a nest forsaken

verses.text_plain: Take counsel, execute judgment; make thy shadow as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; bewray not him that wandereth.
verses.verse_html:
3Take counsel, execute judgment; make thy shadow as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; bewray not him that wandereth. ▼
▼ Take: Heb. Bring

verses.text_plain: Let mine outcasts dwell with thee, Moab; be thou a covert to them from the face of the spoiler: for the extortioner is at an end, the spoiler ceaseth, the oppressors are consumed out of the land.
verses.verse_html:
4Let mine outcasts dwell with thee, Moab; be thou a covert to them from the face of the spoiler: for the extortioner is at an end, the spoiler ceaseth, the oppressors are consumed out of the land. ▼
▼ extortioner: Heb. wringer
 , ▼
▼ the oppressors: Heb. the treaders down

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the oppressors: Heb. the treaders down
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the oppressors: Heb. the treaders down

verses.text_plain: And in mercy shall the throne be established: and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness.
verses.verse_html:
5And in mercy shall the throne be established: and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness. ▼
▼ established: or, prepared

verses.text_plain: We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud: even of his haughtiness, and his pride, and his wrath: but his lies shall not be so.
verses.verse_html: 6We have heard of the pride of Moab; he is very proud: even of his haughtiness, and his pride, and his wrath: but his lies shall not be so.

verses.text_plain: Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab, every one shall howl: for the foundations of Kir–hareseth shall ye mourn; surely they are stricken.
verses.verse_html:
7Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab, every one shall howl: for the foundations of Kir–hareseth shall ye mourn; surely they are stricken. ▼
▼ mourn: or, mutter

verses.text_plain: For the fields of Heshbon languish, and the vine of Sibmah: the lords of the heathen have broken down the principal plants thereof, they are come even unto Jazer, they wandered through the wilderness: her branches are stretched out, they are gone over the sea.
verses.verse_html:
8For the fields of Heshbon languish, and the vine of Sibmah: the lords of the heathen have broken down the principal plants thereof, they are come even unto Jazer, they wandered through the wilderness: her branches are stretched out, they are gone over the sea. ▼
▼ stretched…: or, plucked up

footnotes.body_html: ▼ stretched…: or, plucked up

verses.text_plain: Therefore I will bewail with the weeping of Jazer the vine of Sibmah: I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh: for the shouting for thy summer fruits and for thy harvest is fallen.
verses.verse_html:
9Therefore I will bewail with the weeping of Jazer the vine of Sibmah: I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh: for the shouting for thy summer fruits and for thy harvest is fallen. ▼
▼ the shouting…: or, the alarm is fallen upon, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the shouting…: or, the alarm is fallen upon, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the shouting…: or, the alarm is fallen upon, etc

verses.text_plain: And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the plentiful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be shouting: the treaders shall tread out no wine in their presses; I have made their vintage shouting to cease.
verses.verse_html: 10And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the plentiful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither shall there be shouting: the treaders shall tread out no wine in their presses; I have made their vintage shouting to cease.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore my bowels shall sound like an harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kir–haresh.
verses.verse_html: 11Wherefore my bowels shall sound like an harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kir–haresh.

verses.text_plain: And it shall come to pass, when it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray; but he shall not prevail.
verses.verse_html: 12And it shall come to pass, when it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray; but he shall not prevail.

tokens.text: And it shall come to pass, when it is seen

verses.text_plain: This is the word that the Lord hath spoken concerning Moab since that time.
verses.verse_html: 13This is the word that the Lord hath spoken concerning Moab since that time.

verses.text_plain: But now the Lord hath spoken, saying, Within three years, as the years of an hireling, and the glory of Moab shall be contemned, with all that great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and feeble.
verses.verse_html:
14But now the Lord hath spoken, saying, Within three years, as the years of an hireling, and the glory of Moab shall be contemned, with all that great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and feeble. ▼
▼ feeble: or, not many

footnotes.body_html: ▼ feeble: or, not many
